Asynchronous Stream Interface
[Link Abstraction Layer]

Detailed Description

This modules provides the interface for asychronous streams.

Asynchronous streams are isoc packets that are sent asynchronously (and are subject to asynchronous arbitration).

Typically, async streams are used as a multi-cast method. An example protocol that uses asynchronous streams is IP over 1394.


Functions

 Disable async streams.
HRESULT lalAsyncStreamDisableChannel (uint8 channel)
 Disable a particular async stream channel.

 Enable a particular async stream channel.

 Initialize the hardware to support asynchronous streams.

 Check if async streams are enabled/.

 Register a callback to receive packets on an asynchrous stream channel.

 Send data on an asynchronous stream.

Function Documentation

HRESULT lalAsyncStreamInitialize (  void   ) 
 

Initialize the hardware to support asynchronous streams.

Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT lalAsyncStreamEnable (  void   ) 
 

Enable async streams.

Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT lalAsyncStreamDisable (  void   ) 
 

Disable async streams.

Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

BOOL lalAsyncStreamIsEnabled (  void   ) 
 

Check if async streams are enabled/.

Returns:
TRUE is async streams are enabled.

HRESULT lalAsyncStreamEnableChannel (  uint8  channel  ) 
 

Enable a particular async stream channel.

Typically channel 31 is used.

Parameters:
channel The channel to enable for async streams.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT lalAsyncStreamDisableChannel (  uint8  channel  ) 
 

Disable a particular async stream channel.

Parameters:
channel The channel to disable for async streams.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT lalAsyncStreamRegisterChannelCB (  uint8  channel,
LAL_CALLBACK  callback
) 
 

Register a callback to receive packets on an asynchrous stream channel.

Parameters:
channel The channel to receive on.
callback The callback function to be called.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT lalAsyncStreamSendData (  uint8  channel,
uint8  tag,
uint8  sy,
uint16  bytelength,
uint32 *  bufPtr
) 
 

Send data on an asynchronous stream.

Parameters:
channel The channel to send on.
tag The tag field to use (packet header).
sy The sy field to use (packet header).
bytelength The number of bytes to send.
bufPtr The address of the data to send.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.
